intro: Lepechinia stellata, commonly known as starleaved lepechinia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its small, star-shaped leaves and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Lepechinia stellata is also known for its aromatic foliage, which can release a subtle minty scent when crushed.
